net.sourceforge.taglets.impl.loader
Class MemoryClassLoader

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.ClassLoader
      net.sourceforge.taglets.impl.loader.MemoryClassLoader
Direct Known Subclasses:
JARClassLoader
public class MemoryClassLoader
extends ClassLoader

Class loader that serves in-memory data.

Note:

Initialize this class loader by adding the desired file name, data mappings prior to loading classes with it.

Version:
1.8 (2008/03/30 12:43:18)
Maintainer:
Bruno Essmann <essmann@sourceforge.net>
Since:
1.4.1

          Maps strings of file name entries to byte arrays containing the data.

Method Detail

put

protected void put(String name,
                   byte[] data)
Makes the specified data accessible via this class loader under the given name.

Warning:

Only use this method prior to loading data using this class loader!

Parameters:
name - the file name for the data to put.
data - the actual data to put.
Since:
1.4.1

get

protected byte[] get(String name)
Returns the data bound to the specified file name.

Parameters:
name - the file name of the data to retrieve.
Returns:
the data or null if this file name is unbound.
Since:
1.4.1

isEmpty

protected boolean isEmpty()
Checks if there is data bound to this class loader.

Returns:
true if data is bound to this class loader, false otherwise.
Since:
1.4.1

private byte[] loadClassData(String name)
Retrieves the data of the class with the specified name.

Parameters:
name - the name of the class to load.
Returns:
the class data or null if there are none.

findClass

protected Class findClass(String name)
                   throws ClassNotFoundException
Overrides:
findClass in class ClassLoader
Implementation Notes:
Loads the class data from the in-memory data loaded from the defining URL of this loader.
Throws:
ClassNotFoundException

1.4.1

findResources

protected Enumeration findResources(String name)
                             throws IOException
Overrides:
findResources in class ClassLoader
Implementation Notes:
If there is a resource with the specified name, returns an enumeration with a single element. If there is none, returns an empty enumeration.
Throws:
IOException
Since:
1.4.1
